page.title: 17RAILWAY ELECTRIFICATION
page.content: A 3.3km section of the London to Edin- burgh railway cuts across our block. The line is being electrified, and some bridges over the line are being rebuilt to make room for the overhead cables (which will make the railway line much more obtrusive). Work has already begun on the smaller farm bridges. A few months ago workmen put up a temporary bridge. Then they took the sides of the old bridge down, and took as much of the surface from the top as they could. Then (late at night, after the last train) they covered the track with sleepers and blew the rest of the bridge up. Now they are making the pillars for the new bridge. Careby road bridge was to have been demolished and rebuilt without a temp- orary replacement until public opinion forced a rethink.
